patterns_discovered.description: Combines component-level error boundaries (ErrorBoundary.tsx) with route-level error handling (error.tsx)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Provides comprehensive error coverage at both component and route levels

patterns_discovered.description: Shows full error details (stack trace, error ID) in development mode, but hides technical details in production
patterns_discovered.benefit: Balances developer debugging needs with user-friendly production experience

patterns_discovered.description: ErrorBoundary component accepts optional fallback prop for custom error UI or uses default
patterns_discovered.benefit: Allows flexible error presentation across different sections of application

patterns_discovered.description: Both ErrorBoundary and error.tsx provide reset/retry functionality
patterns_discovered.benefit: Allows users to attempt recovery without full page reload or navigation

patterns_discovered.description: ErrorBoundary accepts optional onError callback for custom error handling (logging, tracking)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Enables integration with error tracking services and custom monitoring

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Error boundaries only catch render-time errors
gotchas_discovered.description: Error boundaries do not catch errors in event handlers, async code, or server-side rendering
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Use try/catch blocks for event handlers and async operations; document this limitation

gotchas_discovered.description: Error boundaries must be implemented as class components, not function components
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Correctly implemented as ErrorBoundary extends Component; documented in comments

gotchas_discovered.description: Next.js error page must be named exactly 'error.tsx' and marked as 'use client'
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: File follows Next.js conventions exactly; clear comments explain requirement

gotchas_discovered.description: ErrorTest.tsx is temporary and should be removed after verification, along with imports and usage in page.tsx
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Documented in ERROR_BOUNDARY_VERIFICATION.md cleanup section with specific removal instructions
